decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 3 - The A3 use hereby permitted shall not begin until full particulars and details of a scheme to insulate the premises against the transmission of airborne and impact sound between the A3 unit and the residential flats above, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The measures so approved shall be implemented prior to the use commencing and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 4 - No commercial kitchen shall be installed or operated until details of a kitchen extract system have been provided to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing.
The system shall be designed so that the maximum operation shall not result in noise that is more than 10dB(A) below background noise levels for the site. The kitchen extract system shall include the following details:
a) A three-stage filtration system, including grease filters, pre-carbon filters and carbon filters, to be located inside the building.
b) The point of discharge shall be a minimum of one metre above eaves level or one metre above openable windows of nearby properties.
c) The ducting shall be circular.
d) The ventilation duct shall terminate pointing directly upwards and shall not be fitted with a cowl.
e) The fan shall be isolated from the inlet and discharge ducts using flexible couplings.
f) The fan shall be mounted using anti-vibration mounts.
g) The duct shall be isolated from the structure of the building using anti-vibration mouldings and suitable packing material where it passes through solid structures.
Condition : 5 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside the following times 7.30 - 22.00 Monday- Saturday and 8.30 - 18.00 on Sundays.
description: Change of use of the existing premises from A2 use to a restaurant and cafe ( A3 use) and installation of awning to provide outside seating area at the front of the shop
